availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: J. Saige Dury (Mt Sterling attorney and 11th District Commwealth's Attorney)

body.p: Mount Sterling attorney and Eleventh Judicial District Commonwealth’s Attorney. Pennsylvania native. Eleventh Judicial District Commonwealth’s Attorney from 1864 to 1868.

bibl.p: John Livingston, Livingston’s United States Law Register, and Official Directory (New York: John A. Gray, 1859), p. 304. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, Mount Sterling, p. 318. William T. Samuels, Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts, of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1865 (Frankfort, KY: George D. Prentice, 1866), p. 10. William T. Samuels, Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts, of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1867 (Frankfort, KY: John H. Harney, 1867), p. 354. The Kentucky Sentinel (Mount Sterling, Ky.), March 5, 1868. Montgomery County Court Clerk, Wills F, 1854 to 1874, Ancestry, p. 197-201.; Find A Grave, "Jacob Dury (unknown-March 7-1868)," Memorial #84918707, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=84918707 (accessed June 5, 2017); Find A Grave, "Jacob Dury (unknown-March 7, 1868)," Memorial #84918707, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=84918707 (accessed June 5, 2017); Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery, Mount Sterling, p. 123.
